title: What attracts snakes to emerge from toilet bowls?
description: Snakes entering toilets are rare, driven by a search for shelter, moisture, or escape from flooding. They follow prey like rodents and insects into underground pipes, with toilets serving as accidental exits. While unsettling, these encounters are not planned attacks. Simple home maintenance can significantly reduce the already low risk.

Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: From lab to YouTube: Google AI CEO celebrates The Thinking Game; 200 million views in four weeks
description: Google DeepMind's documentary, 'The Thinking Game,' has captivated audiences, surpassing 200 million YouTube views in just four weeks.  This compelling film offers an inside look at the groundbreaking work of an AGI lab, highlighting the journey behind Nobel Prize-winning projects like AlphaFold.  CEO Demis Hassabis celebrated the film's immense success and praised the talented creators behind it.

title: MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
description: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk’s public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
description: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk’s public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: Chinese billionaire’s plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 children
description: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: Travis Kelce admits he let Andy Reid down amid Chiefs’ tough season
description: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.
